test_message:
Analyze this CSV data: Date,Amount,Merchant,SMS
2024-01-15,450,Swiggy,Payment of Rs 450 to Swiggy successful
2024-01-20,299,Netflix,Your Netflix subscription of Rs 299 has been charged
2024-02-15,450,Swiggy,Paid Rs 450 to Swiggy
2024-02-20,299,Netflix,Netflix subscription Rs 299 charged
2024-03-10,1200,Amazon,Amazon purchase Rs 1200 completed
expected_purpose: Orchestrates audit workflow and produces Executive Report with Financial Alignment Score

key_insights: High recurring spend detected on Swiggy (food delivery) and Netflix (streaming subscription).
Netflix subscription is active and incurs an annual cost of ₹3588.00.
No future (investment/savings) spends detected in the analysis period.
Swiggy spend indicates frequent food delivery orders and potential opportunity to optimize via consolidation.
Duplicate or repeat transactions found for both Swiggy and Netflix, matching expected recurrence patterns.
recommendations: Review Netflix subscription for ongoing necessity given its recurring cost.
Consider reducing frequency of food delivery orders on Swiggy.
Increase allocations to future-oriented categories (investments, savings) to improve financial alignment.
Inspect duplicate transactions for possible overcharges, particularly with Swiggy orders.

sub_agent_reports.data_extraction: 5 transactions were successfully extracted and structured from the SMS/CSV data.
sub_agent_reports.categorization: Transactions were categorized into 'fixed' (₹598 - Netflix), 'lifestyle' (₹2100 - Swiggy and Amazon), and 'future' (₹0) based on merchant and spending type. Netflix was allocated as 'fixed' subscription; Swiggy and Amazon as 'lifestyle'.
sub_agent_reports.pattern_detection: No unusual anomalies outside expected spending recurrence. Detected 1 ghost subscription (Netflix) and duplicate transactions (Swiggy, Netflix) consistent with usage patterns. Recommendations focus on reviewing subscriptions, order consolidation, and prioritizing future savings.
